name: Primary FRCA SOE (Current Format)
source: RCoA Guide to the FRCA Examination — The Primary, 4th edition (2013, updated 2025)
overview: The SOE is in two parts. Each part consists of six questions examined by two examiners. Each question lasts five minutes so each SOE part lasts 30 minutes.

sections.label: SOE 1 — Physiology & Pharmacology

slots.label: Pharmacology Q1 — Anaesthetic Pharmacology
slots.notes: Inhalational & IV agents, analgesics, NMBs, local anaesthetics

slots.label: Pharmacology Q2 — Principles of Pharmacology
slots.notes: Drug handling (absorption, distribution, metabolism, excretion), pharmacogenetics, statistics

slots.label: Pharmacology Q3 — General Pharmacology
slots.notes: Drug groups (e.g. beta-blockers), drugs for conditions (e.g. oral hypoglycaemics), specific drugs (e.g. antibiotics), NICE guidelines

slots.label: Physiology Q2 — Control Systems
slots.notes: Renal, endocrine, gastrointestinal and other curriculum control systems

slots.label: Physiology Q3 — Applied Physiology
slots.notes: Nerve & muscle, body fluids, or cardiorespiratory if not previously tested. May include inter-relationships and stress responses (trauma, exercise, environment).

sections.notes: Always starts with pharmacology. Both examiners mark independently: fail (0), borderline (1), pass (2) per question.

sections.label: SOE 2 — Clinical Anaesthesia, Physics, Clinical Measurement, Equipment & Safety

slots.label: Clinical Q1 — History & Co-morbidities
slots.notes: Case scenario on laminated sheet. Relevant aspects of history and associated medical problems.

slots.label: Clinical Q2 — Anaesthetic Management / Critical Incident
slots.notes: Problem-solving scenario or critical incident within the clinical case.

slots.label: Clinical Q3 — Further Management
slots.notes: Post-operative care, analgesia options, ongoing management.

examiners.label: Examiner D — Physics, Clinical Measurement, Equipment & Safety

slots.label: Physics/Equipment Q1
slots.notes: Topics from Clinical Measurement, Physics, Equipment and Safety curriculum. Opening question may be clinically contextualised.

slots.label: Physics/Equipment Q2
slots.notes: Same three questions asked in same order at each examiner's table.

slots.label: Physics/Equipment Q3
slots.notes: May include diagrams, photographs, or graphs as supporting material.

sections.notes: Always starts with clinical. Candidates receive laminated case sheet 10 min before entering. Clinical cases pitched at CT2 level.

scoring.method: Both examiners in each SOE part mark all 6 questions independently. Total scores of all 4 examiners aggregated.

notes: 2 SOE parts × 30 min = 60 min total. SOE 1 in morning, SOE 2 in afternoon. Questions reused for two cohorts then changed. Anatomy questions appear within physiology, clinical and physics sections — not as a standalone domain. Legacy format available until June 2028 for candidates with partial pass.
